p:
First, we examined the individual effect of six different types of disruptions, each lasting for three months. A three-month duration was chosen as an illustrative scenario of potential disruptions but does not represent a prediction of how long disruptions will last in reality. The six types of disruptions considered as input assumptions were:
•
‘Reduced contact rates’: Universal 10% reduction in the formation rate of new sexual partnerships
•
‘No new VMMCs’: Cessation in programs implementing VMMC
•
‘Viral suppression decreases by 10%’: A 10% reduction in the proportion of those on ART that are virally suppressed
•
‘No new ART initiations’: Cessation in enrolment in ART programs for persons newly starting ART
•
‘Condom use reduced by 50%’: Condoms are used in 50% fewer sex acts
•
‘Interruption in ART for 40% of individuals’: 40% of those on ART are forced to temporarily discontinue ART
